data: Your model is complete! Now how do you train it? Well first,
there is one more thing you need to configure: The Training
Settings! These are also commonly called the Fit settings
since the AI will try to 'fit' itself to the data. You can
find these by clicking the gray gear in the toolbar at the top.
This will bring up the last three settings you need to consider.
The batch size is the number of samples that the AI will compute
together at the same time. Higher sizes will train faster, but
are more likely to be less accurate. Vice versa is also true:
Lower sizes will train more slowly, but are more likely to
be more accurate.
Epoch is just a fancy word for a single iteration or repitition
of something. Here you control how long the AI will train for in epochs.
Some AI models will be able to minimize their loss in only a few epochs
while others may take hundreds, thousands, or even millions of epochs.
10 is a good starting point for us.
Finally, the Shuffle setting. This shuffles the order the AI model
receives its training data in and prevents it from just memorizing
the order of the answers by accident. Similar to how someone could
cheat on a test by simply memorizing the order of the answers without
learning how to actually get to those answers. It is recommended to keep
this on, but you are always free to experiment.
When you are confident in your Fit settings and the button next to the
gray gear has activated, continue to the next page.
That yellow button in the top center of your screen is the Compile button.
When you click that button, MAI will check through your entire AI model for
any errors and if it finds any it will turn red and tell you what went wrong
below in the console. But if everything checks out it will turn green, write
the code for the AI, and present you with the Train button which is the third
and final button on the AI toolbar.
Go ahead and press Compile! If it turns red, look at the console and try to
fix what it indicates. Go back and read through the other tutorials if needed.
Once you have the green, go ahead and smack that train button and go to the last page!
Congratulations! You created an AI model from scratch! You've learned
about matrices, losses, optimizers, preprocessing, and a whole boatload
of other great skills for your beginning into the field of AI!
